item.title: 电装将全年营业利润预期下调 3.1%
item.description: 丰田汽车的主要供应商日本电装公司（Denso）公布的第一季度利润基本符合分析师预期，但该公司周三将全年营业利润预期下调了 3.1%。【原文：Japan's Denso , a leading supplier to Toyota , reduced its full-year operating profit forecast by 3.1% on Wednesday after reporting first-quarter profit that was largely in line with analysts' expectations.】

item.title: 中国 7 月工厂活动萎缩，服务业增长放缓
item.description: 周三的一项官方工厂调查显示，中国 7 月份的制造业活动连续第三个月萎缩，这使人们继续预期中国政府将需要采取更多刺激措施，因为长期的房地产危机和就业不稳定拖累了经济增长。【原文：China's manufacturing activity in July shrank for a third month, an official factory survey showed on Wednesday, keeping alive expectations Beijing will need to launch more stimulus as a protracted property crisis and job insecurity drag on growth.】

item.title: 中国 7 月非制造业活动增速放缓
item.description: 周三的一项官方工厂调查显示，7 月份中国非制造业活动的增长速度放缓，表明国内服务业需求放缓，并加剧了房地产行业持续多年的危机所带来的困扰。【原文：China's non-manufacturing activity expanded more slowly in July, an official factory survey showed on Wednesday, pointing to slowing domestic demand for services and reinforcing how troubling a years-long crisis in the property sector is.】

item.title: 7 月份中国制造业活动延续下滑态势
item.description: 周三，一项官方工厂调查显示，中国 7 月份制造业活动连续第三个月萎缩，这增强了人们对中国政府需要采取更多刺激措施的预期，因为长期的房地产危机和就业不稳定拖累了经济增长。【原文：China's manufacturing activity in July shrank for a third month, an official factory survey showed on Wednesday, bolstering expectations Beijing will need to launch more stimulus as a protracted property crisis and job insecurity drag on growth.】

item.title: 日本央行招手，亚洲股市紧缩，日元坚挺
item.description: 周三，亚洲股市维持在熟悉的区间内波动，此前，科技行业领头羊微软和芯片制造商 AMD 公布的截然不同的业绩表明，人工智能领域出现了分化，而日元在日本央行的政策决定公布前表现坚挺。【原文：Asian stocks clung to familiar ranges on Wednesday after contrasting results from tech bellwether Microsoft and chipmaker AMD suggested a divide in the AI landscape while the yen was firm ahead of the Bank of Japan's policy decision.】

item.title: 以色列对真主党实施报复后，石油挽回部分损失
item.description: 周三，石油期货收复了部分失地，从7周低点回升，原因是以色列对真主党的袭击进行报复后，地缘政治紧张局势加剧，但中国需求方面的担忧仍令油价承压。【原文：Oil futures clawed back some losses on Wednesday, recovering from 7-week lows as geopolitical tensions rose after Israel retaliated against an attack by Hezbollah, although prices remained under pressure from concerns about demand in China.】

item.title: 日元为日本央行决议做好准备，风险事件层出不穷
item.description: 周三，在日本央行（BOJ）做出关键政策决定之前，日元在2个半月高点附近徘徊，日本央行将详细说明缩减巨额债券购买的计划，加息也是板上钉钉的事。【原文：The yen hovered near a 2-1/2-month high on Wednesday ahead of a key Bank of Japan (BOJ) policy decision where the central bank is set to detail plans to taper its huge bond buying and a rate hike is on the cards.】

item.title: 日本 6 月零售额同比增长 3.7%，好于预期
item.description: 日本政府周三公布的数据显示，日本 6 月份零售额同比增长 3.7%，高于市场预期中值 3.2%。【原文：Japanese retail sales rose 3.7% in June from a year earlier, government data showed on Wednesday, beating a median market forecast for a 3.2% gain.】

item.title: 日本 6 月工厂产出月率下降 3.6
item.description: 日本政府周三公布的数据显示，日本 6 月份工厂产出环比下降 3.6%，而市场预测中值为下降 4.8%。【原文：Japan's factory output fell 3.6% in June from the previous month, versus a median market forecast for a 4.8% drop, government data showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 芯片价格上涨，三星第二季度利润增长逾 15 倍
item.description: 三星电子（Samsung Electronics）周三公布的第二季度营业利润增长超过 15 倍，原因是人工智能热潮推动半导体价格反弹，使盈利从一年前的低点回升。【原文：Samsung Electronics reported on Wednesday a more than 15-fold rise in its second-quarter operating profit, as rebounding semiconductor prices driven by the artificial intelligence boom lifted earnings from a low base a year ago.】

item.title: 全球会计机构希望更严格地显示气候影响
item.description: 一家全球会计机构周三就公司如何进一步说明气候变化对其财务业绩的影响提出了指导意见，称单独披露信息无法为投资者提供所需的清晰度。【原文：A global accounting body on Wednesday proposed guidance on how companies can do more to show the impact of climate change on their financial performance, saying standalone disclosures do not give investors the clarity they need.】

item.title: 美国警告航空公司遵守乘客退款义务
item.description: 美国运输部长皮特-巴蒂吉格（Pete Buttigieg）周二警告美国最大的 10 家航空公司，他们必须遵守国会今年 5 月通过的新的乘客退款义务。【原文：U.S. Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg on Tuesday warned the 10 largest U.S. airlines they must comply with new passenger refund obligations passed by Congress in May.】

item.title: Live Nation 季度利润不及预期，股价下跌
item.description: 周二，Ticketmaster 母公司 Live Nation Entertainment 的第二季度利润不及分析师预期，受运营费用增加的影响，其股价在盘后交易中下跌超过 3%。【原文：Ticketmaster-parent Live Nation Entertainment missed analysts' estimates for second-quarter profit on Tuesday, hurt by higher operating expenses, sending its shares down more than 3% in extended trading.】

item.title: 力拓公布上半年利润基本持平
item.description: 力拓周三公布的半年基本盈利增长基本持平，原因是稳定的发货量部分抵消了略微疲软的铁价。【原文：Rio Tinto reported a largely flat half-year underlying earnings growth on Wednesday as slightly weaker iron prices were partially offset by stable shipments.】

item.title: 人工智能涨势面临分化，微软下挫，芯片制造商攀升
item.description: 本周二，微软公司令人失望的季度业绩使其股票市值缩水 3400 亿美元，与此同时，英伟达（Nvidia）和其他人工智能芯片销售商在先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices .NVIDIA）发布财报后反弹。【原文：Disappointing quarterly results from Microsoft melted $340 billion of stock market value on Tuesday from it and rival heavyweights racing to dominate artificial intelligence technology, while Nvidia and other AI chip sellers rallied after results from Advanced Micro Devices .】

item.title: 日本央行将概述债券缩减计划，讨论加息时机
item.description: 预计日本央行将在周三详细说明缩减巨额债券购买的计划，并就是否加息进行辩论，这表明日本央行决心稳步解除十年来的大规模货币刺激政策。【原文：The Bank of Japan is expected to detail plans to taper its huge bond buying on Wednesday and debate whether to raise interest rates, signalling its resolve to steadily unwind a decade of massive monetary stimulus.】

item.title: 早间竞价今年市场最大的一天
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，英特尔计划裁员数千人以资助经济复苏
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二援引知情人士的话报道，英特尔计划裁员数千人，以资助经济复苏和应对市场份额的侵蚀。【原文：Intel plans to cut thousands of jobs to finance a recovery and cope with eroding market share, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 在首席执行官发出警告后，Stellantis 表示无意出售玛莎拉蒂
item.description: 吉普车制造商 Stellantis 周二表示，无意出售其豪华车业务玛莎拉蒂，也无意将该部门与其他意大利豪华车集团合并。【原文：Stellantis has no intention of selling its luxury vehicle business Maserati or aggregating the unit with other Italian luxury groups, the Jeep maker said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 受人工智能芯片需求影响，AMD 预计第三季度营收高于预期
item.description: 先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices）周二预计第三季度营收将高于市场预期，这主要得益于市场对其人工智能芯片的需求保持强劲。【原文：Advanced Micro Devices forecast third-quarter revenue above market estimates on Tuesday, banking on demand for its artificial intelligence chips staying strong.】

item.title: 中国比亚迪探索进入加拿大汽车市场--监管文件
item.description: 根据本月早些时候提交的一份监管文件，中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪正在寻求进入加拿大汽车市场，尽管加拿大官员正在考虑对从中国进口的汽车征收关税。【原文：Chinese EV maker BYD , is looking to enter the Canadian automotive market, according to a regulatory document filed earlier this month, even as Canadian officials consider imposing tariffs on vehicles imported from China.】

item.title: Tinder 母公司 Match 预测季度收入低于预期
item.description: Tinder 的母公司 Match Group 周二预测第三季度营收将低于华尔街预期，预计随着付费用户的减少，约会应用的自由支配支出将趋于疲软。【原文：Tinder-parent Match Group forecast third-quarter revenue below Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, anticipating weak discretionary spending on dating apps as its paying users decline.】

item.title: 蒙迪艾尔国际公司因需求疲软，季度销售额不及预期
item.description: 吉百利母公司蒙迪艾斯国际公司（Mondelez International）周二公布的第二季度营收未达预期，原因是在通胀严重的情况下，注重预算的消费者选择了价格较低的替代品。【原文：Cadbury parent Mondelez International missed expectations for second-quarter revenue on Tuesday, as budget-conscious customers opted for lower-priced alternatives amid sticky inflation.】

item.title: 竞争加剧，Pinterest 预测营收下滑，股价暴跌
item.description: 本周二，Pinterest 预测本季度营收低于华尔街预期，原因是在数字广告市场趋于稳定的情况下，来自大型社交媒体平台的激烈竞争损害了该公司的业绩。【原文：Pinterest forecast current-quarter revenue below Wall Street expectations on Tuesday, hurt by tough competition from larger social media platforms in a stabilizing digital advertising market.】

item.title: 中国市场疲软，星巴克销售额降幅超预期；利润符合预期
item.description: 星巴克周二公布的第三季度可比销售额降幅大于预期，受美国需求持续疲软和第二大市场中国下降 14% 的拖累。【原文：Starbucks reported a bigger-than-expected drop in third-quarter comparable sales on Tuesday, dragged by stubbornly weak demand in the U.S. and a 14% drop in its second-biggest market, China.】

item.title: 电子艺界预测第二季度预订额高于预期
item.description: 电子游戏出版商电子艺界（Electronic Arts）周二预计，第二季度预订额将高于分析师预期，理由是《EA FC 24》等热门游戏销售强劲。【原文：Videogame publisher Electronic Arts forecast second-quarter bookings above analysts' expectations on Tuesday, citing robust sales of its popular titles such as "EA FC 24".】

item.title: 微软季度营收超出预期
item.description: 本周二，微软第四季度营收超出华尔街预期，主要得益于其云服务和商业软件产品采用人工智能所带来的收益。【原文：Microsoft beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter revenue on Tuesday, driven by gains from AI adoption across its cloud services and business software products.】

item.title: 美国和墨西哥宣布对大众工厂进行整治以保护工人权利
item.description: 美国和墨西哥宣布对墨西哥的一家大众工厂采取补救措施，墨西哥政府已同意对涉嫌侵犯劳工权利的行为进行审查。【原文：The United States and Mexico announced a course of remediation at a Volkswagen plant in Mexico where the Mexican government had agreed to review alleged labor rights violations.】

item.title: 富国银行任命新技术主管
item.description: 路透社看到的一份新闻稿称，富国银行已聘请纽约银行前高管布里奇特-恩格尔（Bridget Engle）担任新的技术主管。【原文：Well Fargo has hired former BNY executive Bridget Engle as its new head of technology, according to a release seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 空客公司因出口管制规定面临英国刑事调查
item.description: 航空航天集团空中客车公司周二表示，该公司在英国的几家实体可能违反了出口管制规定，正面临刑事调查。【原文：Airbus is facing a criminal investigation in Britain into potential violations of export control rules involving several of its UK entities, the aerospace group said on Tuesday.】
